energy: Site energy monitoring through smart metering on temporary power supplies
Use of energy-efficient temporary lighting and battery-powered LED tower lights
Welfare cabin and site office energy efficiency through insulation and timer-controlled heating
Evaluation of hybrid or electric plant and machinery for site operations
Office and permanent facility LED lighting and HVAC optimisation
emissions: Diesel consumption tracking per site for plant, machinery, and generators
Fleet management and vehicle tracking for company vehicles and site deliveries
Quarterly GHG inventory covering Scope 1 (plant diesel, vehicle fleet) and Scope 2 (grid electricity)
Evaluation of HVO (hydrotreated vegetable oil) as diesel alternative for site plant
Embodied carbon assessment for key construction materials (concrete, steel, timber)
waste: Site Waste Management Plan (SWMP) implementation on all projects above threshold value
Segregated skip system on-site: timber, metal, inert, mixed, plasterboard, hazardous
Material ordering optimisation to reduce over-ordering and site waste generation
Demolition waste recovery and recycling through specialist contractors
Off-site manufacturing and prefabrication to reduce on-site waste
water: Wheel wash and dust suppression water recycling systems on construction sites
Silt and sediment management to prevent watercourse contamination from site runoff
Water metering on sites to monitor consumption and identify leaks
Temporary drainage management and pollution prevention measures during groundworks
Sustainable drainage systems (SuDS) design and installation on completed projects

health_safety: Site-specific health and safety plans with risk assessments for each project phase
Toolbox talks conducted daily covering task-specific hazards
Working at height procedures including scaffolding inspections and fall protection
Excavation safety protocols including ground conditions assessment and shoring
COSHH assessments for dust, silica, cement, and other construction materials
Noise and vibration exposure monitoring with hearing and HAV protection
Subcontractor safety induction and competency verification before site access
training: CSCS (Construction Skills Certification Scheme) card or equivalent for all site workers
Site management safety training (SMSTS/SSSTS or equivalent)
Asbestos awareness training for all site-based staff
Manual handling and plant operator certification training
Mental health and wellbeing awareness programme for construction workers
labor_practices: Working hours and overtime tracking across direct employees and subcontracted labour
Living wage commitment for directly employed site workers
Modern slavery due diligence across subcontractor and labour supply chains
Diversity and inclusion initiatives including apprenticeship and women-in-construction programmes
Worker welfare facilities standards including rest areas, washing, and drying rooms

governance: Anti-bribery and corruption policy covering procurement, subcontracting, and client relationships
Prompt payment practices and fair payment terms for subcontractors and suppliers
Confidential reporting mechanism for safety concerns, fraud, or ethical violations
Data protection for project documentation and client information
Annual management review of ethics, compliance, and supply chain due diligence

procurement: Responsible sourcing policy for key materials (timber FSC/PEFC, concrete with recycled aggregate)
Subcontractor pre-qualification including safety record, insurance, and competency assessment
Modern slavery statement and due diligence across labour supply chains
Preference for local suppliers and subcontractors to reduce transport impact
Material environmental product declarations (EPDs) collection for key construction products
Periodic subcontractor performance reviews including safety and environmental criteria

ENVIRONMENT.vision: committed to minimising the environmental impact of our construction activities, reducing site waste, and promoting the use of responsibly sourced materials
ENVIRONMENT.formal: Our Environmental Policy, endorsed by senior management, establishes our commitment to pollution prevention, site waste minimisation, responsible material sourcing, and compliance with applicable environmental legislation and planning conditions
ENVIRONMENT.informal: Environmental management is embedded in our site operations through waste management plans, dust and noise controls, material segregation, and compliance with environmental permits and planning conditions
ENVIRONMENT.roadmap: We are developing a formalised Environmental Policy for publication in {year}, building on our existing site waste management, dust control, and material sourcing practices

LABOR.vision: committed to providing safe working conditions on all construction sites and treating all workers with dignity and respect
LABOR.formal: Our Health & Safety Policy, signed by the Managing Director, establishes our zero-harm objective with specific provisions for construction risks including working at height, excavations, plant operations, and hazardous materials
LABOR.informal: Health and safety is managed through project-specific safety plans, daily toolbox talks, subcontractor inductions, and incident reporting and investigation procedures
LABOR.roadmap: We are formalising our health and safety management approach into a documented policy for {year}, aligning with ISO 45001 and CDM Regulations requirements

ETHICS.vision: committed to conducting business with integrity, fair payment practices, and ethical treatment of all workers including subcontracted labour
ETHICS.formal: Our Code of Business Conduct outlines expectations for ethical behaviour, anti-corruption, prompt payment to subcontractors, and modern slavery due diligence throughout our supply chain
ETHICS.informal: Ethical business conduct expectations are communicated through onboarding, subcontractor pre-qualification, and fair payment practices
ETHICS.roadmap: We are developing a formal Code of Conduct for {year}, consolidating our ethics, modern slavery, and fair payment commitments into a single documented framework

SUPPLY_CHAIN.vision: committed to responsible sourcing, fair treatment of subcontractors, and maintaining high safety and environmental standards throughout our construction supply chain
SUPPLY_CHAIN.formal: Our Supply Chain Code of Conduct establishes minimum expectations for safety competence, environmental management, fair labour practices, and modern slavery prevention for all subcontractors and material suppliers
SUPPLY_CHAIN.informal: Supply chain management is conducted through subcontractor pre-qualification, safety inductions, periodic performance reviews, and preference for responsibly sourced materials
SUPPLY_CHAIN.roadmap: We are developing a formal Supply Chain Code of Conduct for {year}, extending our existing safety-based pre-qualification to include comprehensive ESG criteria and responsible sourcing requirements
